intro: Tibetiodes yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan Tibetiodes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often emit a mild, spicy scent. Tibetiodes yunnanensis is typically found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
